recipe.name: Beggar's Chicken
recipe.description: Beggar's chicken is a traditional dish from Hangzhoui. Legend has it that the disk was indeed created by beggars.

instructions.step: Rub cleaned chicked with salt. Rub ginger juice inside of chicken. Set aside.
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in wok. Stir-fry scallion. Add pork. Stir on high heat. Add sherry, sauce, and sugar. Remove to bowl.
Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in wok. Stir-fry cabbage. Pour in meat mixture. Stir-fry one minute.
Stuff meat mixture into chicken. Wrap in aluminum foil and place in pan.
Back chicken 1 hr at 350 degrees. Turn up heat to 400 degrees and bake 15 more minutes.
Remove foil. Remove stuffing from chicken to platter. Cut chicken into bit-sized pieces. Arrange on top of stuffing.

recipe.name: Chicken with Chestnuts
recipe.description: A popular dish from Shanghai, this dish is quick and easy to make.

instructions.step: Cut chestnuts into halves. Cover with water. Simmer 30 minutes. Remove shells and skin. Set aside.
Heat oil in wok. Stir-fry ginger and scallions 30 seconds. Add chicken. Stir-fry 1 minute. Add sherry, salt, soy sauce, and water. Cover and simmer 30 minutes.
Add chestnuts and sugar. Simmer 10 minutes more.
Bring to high heat and cook 5 minutes. Remove to platter. Serve hot.

recipe.name: Salted Duck
recipe.description: This dish from Nanking is served cold. It works best on a buffet table.

instructions.step: Wash and clean duck. Wipe dry.
Rub duck with salt inside and out. Wrap in foil. Refrigerate 3 days.
Rub inside of duck with ginger juice.
Put duck in large saucepan. Cover with water. Bring to boil. Simmer 2 hours.
Chill. Chop into bite-sized pieces and serve cold.

recipe.name: Beef with Onions
recipe.description: A quick and easy dish from Shanghai. Best served on a bed of rice.

instructions.step: Combine beef, salt, egg white and cornstarch. Mix well.
Heat oil in wok. Deep-fry beef until seared. Drain.
Reheat 2 tablespoons of oil in wok. Add onions. Stir-fry until soft and browned.
Add beef, sherry, sugar, and soy sauce. Stir-fry 1 minute until beef is glazed and brown.

recipe.name: Szechwan Beef
recipe.description: One of the classic chinese dishes.

instructions.step: Mix beef, salt, egg white, and cornstarch.
Heat oil in wok. Deep-fry beef 1 minute. Drain. Remove.
Reheat 2 tablespoons of oil in wok. Stir-fry bamboo shoots and green pepper 30 seconds. Add beef, soy sauce, chili paste with garlic, and sugar. Stir-fy 1 minute. Remove.
Reheat 2 cups of oil in wok to smoking hot. Deep-fry mung bean 1 second. Remove to platter. Pour meat over fried mung bean.

recipe.name: Twice-cooked Pork
recipe.description: This Szechwan dish is extremely popular.

ingredients.ingredient: 1/2 red pepper, cut into thin strips
1/2 green pepper, cut into thin strips

instructions.step: Cook pork in water 20 minutes. Drain and cool.
Cut pork across grains into paper-thin slices.
Heat 2 tablesppons of oil in wok. Stir-fry leek until wilted. Add red and green peppers. Stir-fry 30 seconds. Remove.
Heat 2 more tablespoons of oil in wok. Add pork. Stir-fry 1 minute. Remove.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in wok. Stir-fry bean sauce under moderate heat. Add sugar. Stir-fry 1 minute. Add pork, leek, and peppers. Cook over high heat for 1 minute. Add sherry, soy sauce, and chili paste with garlic. Add garlic and ginger. Stir-fry thoroughly. Add scallion. Stir fry for another 30 seconds.
